page.title: 05The Whitby Gazette.
page.content: The{Whitby Gazette,}founded by the Horne family in 1854, is Whitby's only local newspaper.Mr. Les Heath has been the editor since 1978 when{Scarborough {& District Newspapers}took over. A major change by the new owners was to make the paper a tabloid.Its previous size was twice the area, but had only half the pages.(The original Gazette, no bigger than an A4 sheet, had 16 pages and cost one old penny.) Today's weekly circulation is 13,500.It is filled with information gathered by reporters, locals and the emergency services.The Gazette's staff start printing on a Thursday at 5.30 p.m. and the paper is ready for sale that evening. The editor said that the crashing of a Phantom Jet in an outlying village was one of the most interesting articles he had covered.
